intro: Pinalia obliqua, commonly known as the oblique pinalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Pinalia obliqua thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
